p:
Vacuolar myelopathy is characterized by (Fig. 26.6aâ€“f)
Numerous vacuolar myelin swellings.
Macrophages in multiple areas of the spinal cord.
Predominant involvement of the dorsolateral spinal tracts.
Some macrophages may be found in the vacuoles.
Might not be specific for HIV-1 since they can occur in the absence of HIV.
The axon is at first unaffected, but it is damaged in the later stages of the disease.
VM might not be specific for HIV-1
